TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The "Let's Do the Time Warp Again" Edition

Articles.Content:
Just please make the Engineer report modable, I'd like TAC to be able to list when I don't have enough life support, or DRE to tell me I don't have heat sheilds.

This would be great! It could tell (for TAC) how long your life support will last, and for DRE it will tell you which parts on your ship are vulnerable or unprotected.

@Jim (Romfarer): Maybee you could check if dockingports having their "nondocking" side connected to another docking port or a decoupler. This indicates that there could be a docking port mounted the wrong way, and it would be nice to get a recomendation from the Engeeniers like: "There was found an unusual docking port configuration. Please check before launch."

I'll second this. There is no real reason I can think of that you would want the backside of a docking port connected to either side of another docking port or decoupler and we get questions about this all the time. I presume this checklist is not going to interfere with launching so if someone is building something silly they could still do it.

Fairings. Single part, content shielding fairings so that the hideously unaerodynamic payloads I make will get into space without the antenna or solar panels breaking off or dragging the ship off course.

Don`t make me have to make them from structural panels anymore or have fixed sizes that explode the part count.

Please do it right.

Yeah. I forget action groups more often then parts. But, I don't like the fact fuel will be drained evenly from all tanks. At least from the way it sounds. Main problem with that is. If I want to reserve fuel for my non-jet non-ion engines. It sounds like the jets will take fuel from them when not connected by fuel lines... From the way it is worded. It makes them act like ion engines.

Question is... Is it just for air intakes or is it the liquid fuel too?

Also on another note. Does it mean our Orange suited Kerbals will have orange suits now too? Since the rigs for them are being worked on and also being given moar details...

Will you by any chance put some reaction wheels back in the QBE, since the QBE is the largest of the 0.625 meter parts. Also, would you please release some satellite/probe parts that are going to be smaller than 0.625 meters. For example: 0.35 meter cores with low power usage and solar panels that are small enough so that they aren't the most massive thing on the craft. I feel as if KSP really needs smaller spacecraft parts so that we have spacecraft that represent kicksats, cubesats, tubesats, and various other parts that are mostly for spacecraft made somewhat like it was by a hobbyist, or for actual scientific study.

-please PM me, and Thank You

Astrofox

I like reading about wet wings. The new logic of air breathing engines drawing fuel from all tanks will allow more flexible yet balanced setups. Just make sure that the CoG of wet wings is a tiny little tad in front of CoL and doesn't move when wet wings are flown out. This will have most impact on new aircraft designs aside of new aerodynamics and better lift rating of wings.

Edited January 21, 2015 by DocMoriarty

Forum Switch.

I am neutral-ish on this subject, and have a few questions. Would the current forum be transferred? Will it be hosted on Curse? Will it look a lot like what the demo IPS 4?

On the last two questions, I dearly hope it is not hosted on Curse, and I prefer the current forum to the demo IPS 4.

Looking forward to the unveiling of some of the secret features. Barn 2.0?

Yes, naturally all data on the current forum would be transferred. It will continue to be hosted on the same platform as it always has, afaik. There is no reason to start hosting it on Curse. As for what it looks like, who knows, it might look like the demo, or it might have an entirely different stylesheet. We'll just have to see.

Yes, naturally all data on the current forum would be transferred. It will continue to be hosted on the same platform as it always has, afaik. There is no reason to start hosting it on Curse. As for what it looks like, who knows, it might look like the demo, or it might have an entirely different stylesheet. We'll just have to see.

I played with a demo of an older version of IPS and TBH I was worried up until they told us that was what we were migrating to. IPS is everything VBulletin SHOULD be.

Vexx what happened to your old avatar and why do you have a huge one?

I agree with ferram on the second page. That fuel draining feature isnt really necessary right now. I know itll sound grumpy, but I hope there will be a way to disable it. I know how I want my crafts to be balanced and when. A proper aero, though... Hope itll be not as soupy as the one we have now.

KSP now supports up to 11 joysticks, each with up to 20 axes.

11 joysticks eh? Challenge accepted!

If I could pay for it all.

I played with a demo of an older version of IPS and TBH I was worried up until they told us that was what we were migrating to. IPS is everything VBulletin SHOULD be.

Vexx what happened to your old avatar and why do you have a huge one?

I got bored. Then Kaspy made me change it again because it was way too big. Oh well. I liked the dragon-cat-thing.

11 joysticks eh? Challenge accepted!

If I could pay for it all.

Where are you going to find a joystick with 20 axes? Lead alone 11 of them?

If we count the slider, a Saitek X52 pro (as in, what I fly with) has 7 total analog inputs. Where do you find something with 20? The plus-side is that I can hook up dual sticks (rotation + translation) one with a throttle piece, and possibly rudder pedals. Hmmm . . . . I like . .

- - - Updated - - -

I got bored. Then Kaspy made me change it again because it was way too big. Oh well. I liked the dragon-cat-thing.

Its a dragon-cat, therefore it deserves to stay. Maybe if you up the memory limit with an upgrade to Vexx64 he'll let you keep it.

Jim (Romfarer): This week IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been focusing on the new EngineerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Report app which will replace the Craft Info app. We are keeping everything in the old app, changing the app name and adding a new feature to it: Design Concerns. This is a list of possible problems for your vessel all ranging from simple possibly unimportant issues to crucial errors which will render your vessel unflyable. We already have a list of design concerns in the works but we are always looking for suggestions. So what are the things you Ã¢â‚¬Å“alwaysÃ¢â‚¬Â forget about when designing a vessel?

I want functionality akin to the Engineer Redux plugin in the engineer report. Specifically, I want delta-v per stage and thrust to weight ratio per stage so I don't have to calculate them by hand (not going to happen for a game) or run a mod (as much as I like the mod) to build high performance rockets.

I'd also prefer to hear that 'people don't want to see numbers' as a response to this.

Edited January 22, 2015 by Seyvern

I want delta-v per stage and thrust to weight ratio per stage so I don't have to calculate them by hand

We can all dream.

Where are you going to find a joystick with 20 axes? Lead alone 11 of them?

It was probably the same amount of work to handle 2 axes or 20, so they went with a large number to be safe. Same for the number of joysticks.

Wernher Checker is going stock?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/63591-0-23-WernherChecker-v0-1-2-Customizable-KSP-Checklist-%28Jan-13%29

Seconded. WC does it right; adopt or clone that.

It was probably the same amount of work to handle 2 axes or 20, so they went with a large number to be safe. Same for the number of joysticks.

But... what does a 20-axis joystick even look like?

But... what does a 20-axis joystick even look like?

You can't even perceive all the dimensions it exists in.

You can't even perceive all the dimensions it exists in.

Sigh, don't worry, I'll give Matthew McConaughey a call. Maybe he can help us out.

Just in case people aren't joking and are actually confused, every analog* input on a joystick is an axis. So you've got left/right on the joystick, up/down, turning the joystick (if it does that), the 2 for the hat (l/r and u/d), one for throttle, 2-4 more for shoulder buttons... They can add up pretty quick.

*well, they're still digital but along a line, not just binary on/off

Here's me hoping for more, in terms of joysticks. Support for devices that need Windows calibration. Unity's insistence that you don't need that fancy stuff, leaves a lot of older hardware unusable in KSP. (Work-arounds discussed in this thread.)
Maybe I'll finally complete the tech tree.

I'd like to see support for split axis controls. The XBox 360 controller has this. The analog sticks have a negative and positive X and Y axis, but the LT and RT buttons are analog controls that are just positive. You could assign them to roll or yaw, except roll or yaw can only be one axis in KSP, not two (LT and RT).

I also revised the fuel flow logic for air-breathing engines. To support things like wet wings and such in the future, turbine engines now drain resources evenly from all tanks in a stage
Sounds good. I hope while you're at it you can also fix the air flow logic.
Oh yes, please! Air intakes are not behaving in an intuitive fashion atm. Air resources to each engine need to drain evenly, from all air sources. Odd numbers of different intake types, stuck on the craft at any arbitrary point, should 'just work.'

and why do you have a huge one?

I agree with ferram on the second page. That fuel draining feature isnt really necessary right now. I know itll sound grumpy, but I hope there will be a way to disable it. I know how I want my crafts to be balanced and when.

There most likely will be. Harvester wrote:

That's actually quite right. The engine modules are now able to override the default flow logic as defined by the resource with their own, so even though turbines use the same module as SRBs and Liquid Engines, they set up their own flow logic for LiquidFuel, so that in their case, the lookup method used is the STAGE_PRIORITY method.

For other modules/propellant configs which don't define a particular method, the resource default is used.

As for the necessity that prompted this change, other than the improvement in long-term stability as tanks drain out, this is very much essential to support wet wings and drop tanks. Using the default stack-based flow logic means tanks in child parts (as wings tend to be) will be unaccessible unless a fuel line links them to some spot in the drainage route of the engines. Quite a chore for something that would be expected to just work.

And yes, closing off tanks does still work as always. If you don't want a tank being used, you can close the valves and it'll be left unused.

Cheers

So this STAGE_PRIORITY will presumably be an entry in the engines part file. So MM - or preferably TweakEverything - should be able to restore the old behaviour.

Oh yes, please! Air intakes are not behaving in an intuitive fashion atm. Air resources to each engine need to drain evenly, from all air sources. Odd numbers of different intake types, stuck on the craft at any arbitrary point, should 'just work.'

Sarcasm?

Actually I find it unintuitive for the air to be available for all engines at the same time every time in the same amount - but also that it is not while flying straight, level, with low AoA and the engines not flaming out simultaneously, so maybe what you write would be a good compromise. Hm.

Edited January 22, 2015 by KerbMav
